conclusion: Analyze forces on hemispheres to find friction coefficient.
Two hemispheres A and B between vertical walls; line between centers forms 30° angle with horizontal.
Forces on hemisphere A include gravity, normal force, and frictional forces.
Normal force N from wall balances weight component perpendicular to wall: N = mg cos(30°).
Frictional force f balances weight component parallel to wall: f = mg sin(30°).
Coefficient of dynamic friction μd is given by μd = f / N.
Substitute f and N into μd: μd = mg sin(30°) / (mg cos(30°)).
Dynamic friction factor between hemisphere A and left wall is 1/√3.
